channel.title: Linux on Today I learned
channel.description: Recent content in Linux on Today I learned

item.title: Linux
item.description: Most of the notes are from LinuxNotesForProfessionals Terminal = text input/output environment Console = physical terminal Shell = command line interpreter hostname - Display hostname of the system who - List of all the users currently logged in as a user. w - Display current system status, time, duration, list of users currently logged in on system and other user information. last - Who recently used the system.

item.title: Tidbits
item.description: Make command The make command accepts targets as command line arguments. These targets are usually specified in a file named ‘Makefile’, which also contains the associated action corresponding to the targets. Splat operator This feature allows you to capture a variable number of arguments to a function, combined with “normal” arguments passed in if you like. It’s easiest to see with an example: function concatenate($transform, ...$strings) { $string = ''; foreach($strings as $piece) { $string .
